outside edge rolls past gully's left-handed dive attempt. Length ball in the corridor and Mushfiqur offers very soft hands as he defends from inside the line
lifts it over the slips off the thick outside edge. Short and some width there. He stays under and gets it over
short of a length and just outside off. Pushed into the off side off the back foot
nicely done. Shifts his weight into this full ball outside off and drills it wide of mid-off

big inswinger beats the inside edge but that's done too much and is going down leg. No appeals for lbw. Might have been an inside edge too. Shakib didn't see this coming on the front foot, almost fell over
chips towards mid-on but it goes to that fielder on the bounce. Big inward movement again from a full length and his head's falling over into the off side as he looks to flick
firm punch and then he has to run out of the way as Holder gathers in his follow through and feigns a throw
inside edge onto boot. Short of a length ball hoops in at off stump and he defends with an angled bat
spicy bouncer, but he gets his arms up and allows it sail past his underarm
short ball up at the chest. Gets on top of the bounce and defends

ball, meet middle stump. A shot, from their best batsman, that sums up Bangladesh's match so far. It's all surrender. Gabriel hits a good length after getting him on the back foot the first two balls and it skids through with the angle to whack middle stump as Mushfiqur is looking to defends outside off. Big gap, half a nervous stride. It all looks very bad.
sliced through point to get off the mark. It's very full and all he has to do is get some timing on this. Does it well
length ball wide outside off, left alone
short ball fired down leg side. Dowrich leaps to his left and parries it to fine leg
short of a length and swinging away late outside off. Defended to point off the outside half
short of a length outside off, defended off the backfoot
full, tempting outswinger outside off. Left alone
uppish but safely through cover. Follows the swing and leans in on it without a big stride
keeps low as he goes back but he just manages to get bat on it. Wide of the crease from Holder, slanted in at a good length
beats the outside edge. Late swing away in the corridor, lazy waft at it from the batsman
short ball wide outside off, watchful cut to point
yorker at off stump, jammed out to mid-off
length ball slanted down leg side. Can't get bat on the flick
short of a length but way down leg side. Left alone
nervous prod into the leg side. That front foot wasn't moving at all as he defended this length ball in front of middle stump

caught at third slip! Superb bowling and a lovely catch from Holder. Shakib looks to defend in front of off, but this ball has jagged away from him after angling in. Not much more he can do about that. The edge goes low to Holder's right and he does superbly to get down and scoop it up
short and wide outside off, cut to point's right and it's stopped with a dive
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
length ball shaping away from middle. Defended solidly in front of off
oh what a ball. Starts middle and leg, swings away and past the outside edge as he looks to defend. Unplayable.
length ball in the corridor, swinging away. Good stride forward to defend
outswinger at a length outside off, left alone
short ball outside off. Doesn't get behind the line as he looks to punch through cover from the crease. Inside edge into the pitch
short ball at off stump, defended off the back foot

well timed. Length ball outside off, jabs at it and opens the face to get it to the backward point boundary. Shakes his head furiously afterwards - his feet were rooted and he was chasing far away from the body
beaten. After a furious pep talk to himself for chasing away from the body, he does exactly that the next ball. Full outswinger wide outside the stumps and he looks for the big drive on the up
short and outside off. Jags back in as he lets this go
short and very wide. Left alone
in the air but through cover again. Length ball outside off and he drives on the up with an open face. Luckly for him this doesn't shape away
keeps low as he stays on the back foot and defends in front of the stumps
swipe and miss. Can't get close to this short and wide ball as he looks to cut
short of a length outside off, defended into the slip region off the back foot

a straightforward catch. This Holder fella can bowl. He owns that corridor today. Angle in, shape away and for added flavour, lift off the surface through his height. Mehidy, promoted to No. 7, looks to defend but this gets too big on him. Tickled through for a straightforward catch
beats the outside edge. Nurul survives. Another ball jagging off the seam outside off as the batsman looks to defend
catches his glove first up. That pops up nastily from the pitch as he looks to defend off the back foot. Glove and then bicep. If you were happy Gabriel was off...
just gets it past short leg. Another short one into his body and he drags it, uppishly, to short leg's left
full outside off, leans in and toe-ends a drive through cover
uppish hook shot to fine leg. Caught on the front foot as this short one rises at his chest
past the outside edge. Stuck on the crease after the first few balls that reared up at him. This is an overpitched ball prime for a drive. He fishes at it
short and wide, misses as he looks to cut
top edge clears the keeper as he runs back and to his left. No idea with that one, Nurul. Walks down the pitch and it's a bouncer. He withdraws from the pull shot and in the end it's just fending
length and shaping away from off stump. Defended into the covers off the back foot
short of a length outside off, thick outside edge lands short of the cordon as he defends inside the line
good length, swinging away outside off. Blocked on the front foot
aerial pull to fine leg's left. Drags this short ball from outside off. Can't get over it
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short and wide outside off, too steep for the cut. He's beaten
length ball outside off, stabs on the up and opens the face. Point dives to his left to keep it to one
full on middle stump, holds his shape and gently taps this through the open mid-on region. Gabriel gets some exercise at mid-off

add one more. Or not. Cummins has overstepped. Facepalm from Stuart Law. Mahmudullah has both feet inside the crease as he looks to drive through cover against a rising length ball. Chasing a long way, can only slice it to point's right. A nice lunging catch. To no avail.
short ball, fired wide down leg side and left alone
length outside off, big stride forward to nudge this in front of point
short ball at off stump, shuffles across and dead-bats it into the pitch
back of a length and slanted down the leg side, Dowrich tumbles to his left to gather the ball

Holder strikes with his second ball and finds the outside edge of Mahmudullah. Fair delivery from Holder but is it a fair catch? The two umpires converge and refer it to the TV umpire. Yes, it's a legal catch. TV umpire Ravi sends back Mahmudullah. On a length and angling in from over the wicket, kicks up and seams away. The batsman is squared up as he dangles his bat in the channel and snicks it off to third slip diving low to his right
on a length and outside off, Kamrul plays with soft hands and pokes to gully
pitched up and angling in on middle, poked back to the bowler now

pitched up and angling in at off, takes the outside edge but does not carry to second slip. An appeal for caught behind. Not given by the umpire. Holder has a word with Dowrich and challenges the on-field not-out decision. Fair delivery all right. Nice and full, slanting in at off, Kamrul is pinned to the crease wafts at it. Did the edge carry to second slip? The close-ups suggest the ball bounced before second slip gathered it
short and kicking up at the body, cramps the batsman for room, fended away to the off side
full and angling down the leg side, tickled away fine past the diving keeper
full and slanting into the pads, the batsman is on the move as he drives to wide long-on
very full and wide outside off, brings his bat down and jabs it away, threading the cordon for four
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, throws his hands at a cut and trickles it past the leg stump off a thick inside edge
Nurul chases a full ball that holds its line outside off and is beaten on the outside edge
back of a length and angling into a back-foot defence
short at the body, fended off to the leg side
on a length and nips away outside off, opens the face and taps the ball away to point
full and outside off, rides it to gully with soft hands
back of a length and skids in with extra bounce, catches the glove and lobs wide of forward short leg
back of a length, angling in and jabbing away past the outside edge
full and angling in at off, the batsman camps back and nudges it to cover-point region
shortish and outside off, gets behind the line and pats it away to backward point
Nurul gets on top of a short ball outside off and firmly punches it square through the off side. Something to cheer for Bangladesh fans
full and wide outside off, swished over the top. Nurul reaches out for the ball and lifts it over the covers
back of a length and zipping in to catch the pad outside the line. The batsman was also shimmying out of the crease. Not given lbw. No review from WI
back of a length and bounces outside off, left alone
Nurul opens the face late and runs it away to the cordon with soft hands
good length and largely holds its line outside off, ignored in the channel
full, angling in at off, cutting away sharply past the outside edge
backs away and drives to the covers does Rubel
full and outside off, scoops a drive wide of point
full and angling in at off, jabbed away to the cordon
full and tailing in at off, defended away to the leg side
full and outside off, shuffles across off and misses a scoop
an appeal for caught behind. Not given. Back of a length, angling in, tailing away, bounces over the bat on its way to the keeper
short at the body, the batsman cops a blow
squirted away to long leg
guided off the face to gully
bouncer outside off, sways his upper body out of the way
full on middle, played back to the bowler
back of a length and slanted down leg
short and darted into the body, Kamrul looks away and cops a nasty blow on the helmet. He's okay, though. Kamrul needs some attention from the physio
bouncer outside off, sways away
Another five-wicket haul from Gabriel. Follows the short ball with a much fuller one on middle stump, Kamrul has an almighty leg-side slog at it and loses his middle stump
back of a length and outside off, swings and misses
makes room, bowler floats in a full ball on the pads, clipped uppishly through midwicket
right behind the line as he defends this back of length delivery
full and swinging away from the off stump, he has a royal waft at that without moving his feet. No prizes for guessing what happened. Beaten
hops across and punches this back past the bowler to get off the mark, no mid-on so a single is possible.
walks across a long way to flick, Holder slides this way down leg, through to the keeper.
full and moving away from off stump, eased to point for a quick single.
this was destined to be four byes, until Dowrich leapt high, put out his right hand and stopped that steep bouncer. Well done.
on the pads, flicked away nicely to the deep midwicket region
uppish but away from the bowler. Turned the bat face early to flick, lobbed towards the non-striker.
too much width, he stands tall and punches this uppishly to the backward point boundary. Stylish from Nurul.
squeezes this yorker-length delivery to mid-on

helped along to the fine leg boundary. Too short, he shaped to pull but fell over, still managed to get some glove on the way. Would you believe it? Both batsmen tap gloves to celebrate as Bangladesh bring up their 100!

slower and fuller outside off, this has been belted over mid-off, carries all the way. Looks like Nurul has decided to prepare for the BPL. Left with no choice but to attack, he's picking off boundaries at will now
wristy whip off this length ball past short leg
backs away, so the bowler follows him as he digs one in to the body, Nurul somehow manages to arch back and ramp this over the keeper.
full and swinging away from outside off, laced into the gap at extra cover

prods outside the line to get a thick inside edge on this full delivery to fine leg. There's a half-century . Each and every member in that Bangladesh change room stands up to applaud. The selectors are happy too. Rubel walks across to give him a fist bump.
plays inside the line as he watches this through
whipped uppishly towards the midwicket boundary, just stops as it approaches the ropes. They take two, abort the third for it would mean Rubel would take strike again, which they don't want
stands tall to defend this length ball, gets a thick inside edge onto the pad and boot.
nips back in to hit the thigh pad and roll to the off side.
stands tall and defends this length delivery with soft hands
solid in defence. Angles back in from wide of the crease, played with soft hands.
squared up but in trying to pull out, the ball thuds into the bat and rolls past gully
tucked away nicely off his pad, good work by the short leg fielder to stop some runs.
short, he rocks back and pulls that half-tracker over deep midwicket. Super hit
punches this short ball to long-on, jogs the single
drifts in but keeps a touch low from length, squeezed wide of midwicket
whipped into the vacant midwicket region for an easy single
edged, just wide of slip. Races towards the third man boundary but retrieved by Chase. Just fell short of Devon Smith
punched back to the bowler.
eased down towards the vacant mid-on for a single, mid-off runs across to cut that off
there for the drive, Nurul takes a step across and leaves
right on top of the bounce as he defends with soft hands towards short leg
touch full and just outside off, left alone. Looks like he overstepped in delivery that ball, not called
has he gloved this? Perilously close to it as he looks to hook. Steep bounce from Cummins
defended back to the bowler from the crease
